meaningMnemonic:
When you make a <kanji>duplicate</kanji> <kanji>copy</kanji> you are <vocabulary>copying</vocabulary> things. Especially if you're making a <vocabulary>photocopy</vocabulary> or a <vocabulary>carbon copy</vocabulary>. It's like a copy of a copy! 

複写 is a pretty formal word for copying documents, text, or images. It's still often used to talk about carbon copies. But for photocopies, most people just say コピー(する) these days.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
